summary: Feature request to simplify protobuf payload converter usage by leveraging protobufjs's global module.roots field instead of requiring users to pass a root argument. This would reduce configuration complexity but requires compatible package manager setup and duplicate message name handling.
userImpact: Users would have simpler protobuf integration without needing to pass root arguments to converters, but the feature was not completed due to bundle size concerns.
rootCause: Bundle size bloat when importing protobufjs/light directly into the default payload converter (increasing from 0.25 to 0.5 MB).
proposedFix: Use protobufjs global module.roots field to discover proto definitions instead of requiring explicit root argument, with requirements for package manager deduplication and pbjs code generation.
resolutionDetails: Feature was not completed due to bundle size implications. Importing protobufjs/light would double bundle size, and webpack integration would require complex hacks to conditionally load the dependency.
keyQuote: It requires importing `protobufjs/light`, which doubles the bundle size (.25 to .5 MB)
